result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel J Cerna was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Cocaine (>40g) [Modifiers: Conspire to Manufacture/Deliver Drugs], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)4.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Imposed and Stayed. Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 3 years bifurcated sentence.
Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Court costs are waived. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Comply and participate in recovery program. Comply with family court order. Mental health assessment and follow through with recommendations. Pay outstanding ZCI fees. Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

timeConds.notes: STAYED. Credit for time served only to be applied if revoked.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

  Status conference scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 09:30 am.

PLUS $3,000 CO-SIGNED BY AUNT - ELENA LAGODICH WITH PHOTO I.D.
Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  House arrest at home of Aunt. May leave for atty appointments and court. May also leave for treatment and assmt appointments - every appointment must be documented. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment. No contact with anyone associated with the arrest including the CI, and no contact with any known drug user. The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Daniel J Cerna in court with attorney Margaret Marie Johnson.  Defendant Daniel J Cerna in custody.  Randall Schneider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee. 
Defense motions to dismiss based upon lack of probable cause and jurisdiction. State objects.  
BTC: Motion to dismiss is denied. Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 13, 2015 at 09:00 am.
